title: Security Package Analysis Checklist (Leveraged Lending)
description: A checklist to guide the review and analysis of a security package in a leveraged loan transaction from a credit perspective. Based on principles in Section II.F and related areas.

questions_to_consider: Are all material operating subsidiaries included?
Are holding companies providing guarantees?
What is the jurisdiction of each Guarantor?
Is there a guarantor coverage test (e.g., % of Group EBITDA, Assets, Revenue)?
What is the required threshold?
Is current coverage compliant? How is it tested/monitored?
Are there provisions for adding new guarantors if coverage drops?
Are guarantees joint and several?
Are they full and unconditional (subject to legal limitations)?
What are the limitations on guarantees (e.g., corporate benefit, financial assistance, solvency caps, jurisdictional limits)?
Are there upstream, downstream, or cross-stream guarantees?
What are the associated risks/enforceability concerns (especially for upstream)?

items.point: Identify all material asset classes intended to be secured.
questions_to_consider: Shares (of Borrower, key subsidiaries)?
Bank accounts (operating, collection, specific reserves)?
Real estate (owned, material leaseholds)?
Intellectual Property (patents, trademarks, copyrights, key licenses)?
Material contracts (customer, supplier)?
Insurance policies?
Trade receivables?
Plant, machinery, equipment?
Inventory?

items.point: Understand the type of security taken over each asset class.
questions_to_consider: Fixed charge/mortgage (specific assets)?
Floating charge (all assets/undertaking)?
Pledge (shares, physical assets)?
Assignment (contractual rights, receivables)?
Is there an all-asset debenture or general security agreement?
Are there reasons for exclusion (e.g., cost, legal impossibility, immateriality)?
What is the value/importance of excluded assets?

items.point: Assess the quality and potential realizable value of key collateral.
questions_to_consider: Are there third-party valuations? When were they done?
How liquid is the collateral?
Are there any factors that could impair value in a distress scenario (e.g., specialized nature, obsolescence)?

items.point: Confirm perfection steps taken for each key asset class in relevant jurisdictions.
questions_to_consider: Registration (e.g., Companies House, UCC filings, IP registries)? Timelines met?
Possession (e.g., share certificates)?
Control (e.g., account control agreements)?
Notice to third parties (e.g., contractual counterparties for assignments)?

items.point: Are there legal opinions confirming due creation and perfection of security?
questions_to_consider: What qualifications or assumptions are made in these opinions?

items.point: What are the consequences of any failure to perfect or delayed perfection?
Determine the intended ranking of the lenders' security.
questions_to_consider: Is it first priority? Second priority? Other?
Are there any prior ranking statutory liens (e.g., tax, employee claims that have priority)?
What other liens are permitted to exist on the collateral?
Do any permitted liens rank ahead of or pari passu with the lenders' security?
Are there baskets for general liens or liens securing other debt?

items.point: If multiple debt tranches, analyze the Intercreditor Agreement (ICA).
questions_to_consider: Does the ICA clearly establish lien subordination between tranches?
Who has control over enforcement of shared collateral?
What are the standstill provisions for junior lenders?
How does the waterfall for enforcement proceeds operate?

items.point: Have priority searches been conducted? What did they reveal?

questions_to_consider: Are there any practical or legal obstacles to enforcing security in key jurisdictions?
What are the likely costs and timelines for enforcement?
Is appropriate insurance maintained over secured assets?
Are lenders noted as loss payees?
Are there covenants requiring the borrower to protect/maintain secured assets and the security interests?
Under what circumstances can security and guarantees be released (e.g., asset sales, refinancing, subsidiary becoming immaterial/unrestricted)?
Are these provisions appropriate?

overall_assessment_prompt: Based on the above, what is the overall strength and comprehensiveness of the security package? What are the key weaknesses or risks?
source_reference_note: This checklist is informed by Section II.F (The Security Package in LMA Leveraged Loans) and related principles from the 'Leveraged Lending: A Comprehensive Legal Knowledge Base' document.
